# PTD Today - Monthly (Last 30 Days) Intelligence Brief

## 1) Top Themes
- Significant developments in renewable energy projects, especially offshore wind and solar PV expansions.
- Growing focus on integrating AI and digital twins for energy and data center applications.
- Security incidents affecting critical subsea infrastructure.
- Policy and market updates on solar and battery storage, including domestic content mandates.
- Limited activity or information regarding oil & gas and critical minerals sectors.

## 2) Top Stories
- Chinese offshore wind leads single-unit turbine capacity with Vestas installing a 15 MW turbine in 2025 (Source: offshorewind.biz).  
- Apollo becomes co-owner of the Hornsea 3 offshore wind farm, expanding investment in large-scale renewables (Source: offshorewind.biz).  
- UK solar market poised for record Contract for Difference (CfD) deployments in 2026, signaling robust growth (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- US solar market projected to reach 737.8 GW capacity by 2035, indicating strong long-term expansion (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- India mandates 20% domestic content in battery storage projects to boost local manufacturing (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- Finland seizes a ship allegedly involved in cutting subsea cables, highlighting vulnerabilities in data infrastructure security (Source: datacenterdynamics.com).  
- China solar module prices expected to reach as low as CNY 1/W in 2026 due to wafer price increases and market dynamics (Source: pv-magazine.com).  
- New digital twin technology utilizing AI developed for floating photovoltaic (PV) applications, enhancing operational efficiency (Source: pv-magazine.com).  

## 3) Sector Takeaways

### Grid / Transmission
- Subsea cable security is a growing concern following the seizure of a ship for allegedly cutting cables in Finnish waters (Source: datacenterdynamics.com).  
- US states ordering utilities to enable flexible grid connections for community solar projects reflect grid adaptation for distributed renewables (Source: pv-magazine.com).  

### Renewables
- Offshore wind developments remain strong globally with China leading turbine size and Western investors increasing stakes in projects like Hornsea 3 (Sources: offshorewind.biz).  
- Solar PV trends show aggressive deployment targets, domestic manufacturing mandates, and cost pressures impacting module prices (Sources: pv-magazine.com).  
- Battery storage projects in India face new local content requirements, signaling policy-driven market shaping (Source: pv-magazine.com).
